page.title: 12DAIRY FARMING IN A_J_M
page.content: The cattle are kept out at grass between the beginning of May and the end of October and brought in for {milking twice a day}.On some farms when they have recently calved they are milked 3 times a day.They are moved inside in the winter and fed on {silage,hay,straw,brewers grains and {the concentrates}which are fed at milking times in the summer.The concentrates are measured and fed acc- ording to the milk production of the cow.The grass is cut for{silage}2,3,or even 4 times a year and is stored on some farms in large black polythene sacks,as well as in large mounds under polythene weighed down with tyres. {Straw}also used for bedding is usually brought from the south as little is produced in Cheshire.
